Aia nō kekahi ʻano lāʻau e haʻi ʻia i loko o ka moeʻuhane. Ua ʻike au i kēlā ʻano. No ka mea, ma hope o koʻu hānau ʻana i kaʻu keiki helu ʻehā, ua oki loa koʻu kino, ʻōmaʻimaʻi au. Ua hele mai koʻu māmā e kiʻi iaʻu me kaʻu mau keiki i hiki iā ia ke kōkua iaʻu, ma ka mālama i kaʻu mau keiki me aʻu pū. Hoʻokahi lā e hiamoe iki ana au, a loaʻa iaʻu ka moeʻuhane. Ala au a haʻi aku nei au iā Māmā i kaʻu moeʻuhane. ʻO ia hoʻi, i loko o kaʻu moeʻuhane, hele mai nei kēia kanaka. A i loko o kona poli he pūʻā lāʻau ʻihi, ke ʻihi me ka pua ʻākala. Hāʻawi mai ʻo ia iaʻu i kēlā pūʻā ʻihi. Ala au. Kākaʻikahi koʻu manawa e moeʻuhane ai. No laila, haʻi aku nei au i kaʻu moeʻuhane iā Māmā. Pane mai nei ʻo ia, “Auē, ʻO kāu lāʻau kēlā. Hele kākou e kiʻi i kāu lāʻau.” A hele ana mākou, ʻohi ʻihi a loaʻa, hoʻihoʻi i ka hale. A hoʻokaʻawale ʻo Māmā i ka lau maikaʻi a kaulaʻi ʻia; a maloʻo, kupa ʻia i kī. Mai kēlā manawa mai ʻo ia wale nō kaʻu wai e inu ai, ke kī o ka wai ʻihi. ʻO ia ka wai e kupa ʻia ai kaʻu meaʻai, ʻo ia ka wai e hoʻowali ʻia ai kaʻu poi. Pēia au i ʻai ai i kaʻu lāʻau a hala he mau mahina paha. Ma hope mai, hoʻomaka au e ʻono i ka ʻai; maikaʻi maila koʻu olakino; pau koʻu ʻōmaʻimaʻi. ʻŌlelo mai ʻo Māmā, “ʻAʻole e maikaʻi inā hoʻohui ʻia ka lāʻau a ke kauka me ka lāʻau lapaʻau. No laila inā he lāʻau lapaʻau kāu e ʻai ana, ʻo ia wale nō ka lāʻau e ʻai ai.”
Aia nō kekahi ʻano lāʻau, ʻo ka lāʻau kāhea — no ka iwi haʻi, me ka maui, a i ʻole ka iwi pahemo. ʻO ke keiki a koʻu kaikunāne, ua pahemo ka iwi o kona lima — ua nui kona ʻehaʻeha. A aia lākou i Hilo kahi i noho ai. No laila, ua noho ʻo ia i ka hale a ua hele mai kona makuahine i Kalapana e ʻike ai i kekahi wahine, he Hawaiʻi, e hoʻoponopono no ka pilikia o kāna keiki. Ua maopopo ʻia e pili ana i kēia wahine i Kalapana no kona ʻike e pili ana i ka lāʻau kāhea. No laila, hui lāua, walaʻau pū. He mau lā ma hope mai ua ola ka iwi pahemo — pau ka ʻehaʻeha. I ka manawa i hoʻomaka ai ʻo ʻAnakē Luika i kona hoʻokiʻo ua nui kona heʻe koko, malule ʻo ia. Ua hana ʻo ʻAnakala Kaipo, kāna kāne, i lāʻau Hawaiʻi. Ua hele ʻo ʻAnakala Kaipo i Kupahuʻa e kiʻi i ka lepo ʻalaea. A ua hele au me ia. I Kupahuʻa, ma kekahi pali haʻahaʻa, he ana liʻiliʻi. Ma ka paia o ke ana ka lepo ʻalaea. Maʻemaʻe kēlā ana. Kopekope māua i ka lepo ʻalaea me ka iwi ʻopihi. A hoʻokomo i loko o ka pūʻolo. ʻIke au iā ʻAnakala e hana ana i ka lāʻau i ka hale — ka lau nahele, ka paʻakai me ka lepo ʻalaea. Hana ʻo ia i ka lāʻau a pau. Hāʻawi ʻo ia iā ʻAnakē. ʻO ia kāna lāʻau e ʻai ai. Ma hope mai ua pau ka heʻe koko o ʻAnakē.
Eia nō kekahi, ua maʻi ʻo ʻAnakē Kanoe, a lawe kāna kāne ʻo ʻAnakala ʻOulu iā ia e ʻike i ke kauka. A ua haʻi ʻo Kauka Irwin iā lāua he maʻi ʻaʻai i loko o ka ʻōpū o ʻAnakē. A ua ʻōlelo ke kauka e ʻoki — a ua hōʻole lāua. Ua hele lāua e ʻike i kekahi kahuna lapaʻau i ʻŌlaʻa. Ua ʻōlelo ke kahuna lapaʻau iā ʻAnakala ʻOulu i kāna mea e hana ai. Kiʻi i ka lāʻau Hawaiʻi. ʻIke mau wau iā ʻAnakala, kau ʻo ia ma luna o kona lio, hele ʻo ia i ke kuahiwi a i ʻole i ke kahakai e huli ai i ka lau nahele no ka lāʻau a ʻAnakē. ʻIke au iā ʻAnakala i ka hoʻomākaukau i ka lāʻau a hāʻawi iā ʻAnakē Kanoe e inu. Ma hope mai, ua ola maikaʻi kona kino, ʻo ʻAnakē Kanoe, a ua lōʻihi nā makahiki i ola ai ʻo ia.

ʻO Ka Hoʻoponopono

I ka wā aʻu e noho ana me koʻu ʻohana, i koʻu wā ʻōpiopio, nui nā mea aʻu i ʻike ai a i lohe ai e pili ana i ka hoʻoponopono. He nui nā lula maʻalahi — inā ʻoe e hele i ke kahakai a i ʻole i ke kuahiwi, a i ʻole i ka home, e hana maikaʻi ʻoe i nā pōkiʻi me nā poʻe ʻē aʻe. ʻŌlelo mai koʻu makuahine iaʻu, “Mai hanaʻino iā haʻi. No ka mea, aia ko lākou ʻaumakua ke kiaʻi maila iā lākou. Inā ʻoe e hana hewa ana iā haʻi, ma hope nō e loaʻa ana ka hoʻopaʻi iā ʻoe.” ʻŌlelo mai koʻu makuahine iaʻu, “ʻOiai ua hala ko kākou mau kūpuna, aia nō lākou ke kiaʻi maila iā kākou. ʻAʻole hiki iā kākou ke lohe a i ʻole ʻike iā lākou. Akā hiki iā lākou ke ʻike me ka lohe iā kākou.” No laila, ʻO kā kākou mea e hana pono ʻole ana i ke kanaka, ʻo ka hopena, e ili ana ka hewa ma luna o kākou — mālia paha ʻo ka maʻi, a i ʻole ka ulia pōʻino. Inā pēlā, pono e hoʻoponopono ʻia, i maopopo ʻia ke kumu o ka pilikia — inā ma waena o ʻelua paha poʻe a i ʻole ma waena o ka ʻohana a i ʻole ma waena o ka pūʻulu. Ma mua o ka hoʻomaka ʻana o ka hoʻoponopono, pono e loaʻa he alakaʻi. ʻO ke kupuna nō ka mea kūpono no ke alakaʻi. A e ʻāpono nā poʻe a pau i ka hana hoʻoponopono. E hui pū, kūkā i ka pilikia a pau ka hihia, mihi aku mihi mai, a huikala ʻia nā pilikia. Pau kēlā, hoʻopau ʻia me ka pule, ʻo ia hoʻi, ka pule hoʻopau.
No ka hele ʻana e ʻike i ke kahuna hoʻoponopono, i kekahi manawa, hele nō no hoʻokahi wale nō manawa, a hiki ke hoʻoholo ʻia ka pilikia. I kekahi manawa, he mau hele ʻana. Hoʻomanaʻo au i ka manawa i loaʻa ai ʻo Māmā i ka maʻi. Ua hele ʻo Māmā e ʻike iā ʻAnakē Maka, i Pāhoa. Naʻu i kalaiwa ke kaʻa a lawe au iā Māmā i ka hale o ʻAnakē Maka. I kekahi manawa inā he moeʻuhane kā Māmā, haʻi akula ʻo ia i ke kahuna. Wehewehe maila ke kahuna i ka moeʻuhane. I kekahi manawa ma ka moeʻuhane e loaʻa ai ka manaʻolana e pili ana — inā he hewa, a i ʻole hōʻea mai ka ʻuhane — kāhea ʻia kēlā he makani. Inā e hōʻea mai ana ka makani, ʻōlelo aʻela ke kahuna iā Māmā, “Ā, eia mai ke kolohe.” ʻO ke kolohe, ʻo ia hoʻi ka inoa o ko mākou ʻuhane kiaʻi. Walaʻau akula ke kahuna i ka ʻuhane, me ke ʻano minoʻaka, a i ʻole ʻakaʻaka — kohu mea e walaʻau ana ʻo ia i kekahi poʻe. Kohu mea e hoʻolohe ana ʻo ia i ka pane paha. Aia naʻe hoʻokahi wale nō leo aʻu e lohe nei, ka leo o ke kahuna. Ke walaʻau nei ʻo ia i ka makani e pili ana i ka maʻi o Māmā me ka moeʻuhane. ʻAno lōʻihi kona walaʻau ʻana me ka makani, a laila huli maila ke kahuna, kūkā me Māmā. A pau, walaʻau hou ʻo ia me ka makani. A huli aʻela ke kahuna, ʻōlelo iā Māmā, “Pehea ʻoe me kou kaikunāne?” ʻŌlelo aʻela ʻo Māmā, “ ʻAe...” ʻO ko lāua hoʻopaʻapaʻa, ko lāua kūʻē. ʻŌlelo ʻia iā Māmā e pono ʻo ia e hele e ʻike e mihi i kona kaikunāne. Walaʻau aʻela ke kahuna, “ʻĀ, ke hoʻi ala ke kolohe. Ua pau ka pilikia.” A ua hele ʻo Māmā e hana i ka mea i haʻi ʻia mai iā ia. A ua ola kona maʻi. A ua maikaʻi ka noho ʻana me kona kaikunāne. No laila ua holopono nā hana — ua mihi, ua kala, ua ʻoki ʻia nā pilikia.
I kekahi manawa, he hana mihi hōʻeha ma ke ʻano hoʻokē ʻai — mai ke kakahiaka a hiki i ke awakea ʻaʻole meaʻai, ʻaʻole wai. He manawa haipule me ka noʻonoʻo. Mālia paha ʻo ka hoʻokē ʻai he mau lā. Aia nō i ke ʻano o ka nui o ka pilikia.
No laila, inā he maʻi ke kanaka, hāʻawi ʻia ka lāʻau lapaʻau. Inā mau ka maʻi, a laila, hele ʻia i ke kahuna hoʻoponopono. I kekahi manawa ua mau nō ka maʻi, ua lohe au i ka ʻōlelo ʻia, “ʻAʻole ʻo ia i ʻōlelo me ka pololei i kona hewa. Ua ʻauʻa nō paha ʻo ia i kekahi mau manaʻo.” A i ʻole, “ʻAʻole i ʻoiaʻiʻo ka mihi ʻana, ke ʻoki ʻana.”
Inā hāʻule he mea ʻōpiopio, he mea kaumaha loa kēlā. Inā hāʻule i ka wā ʻelemakule, ka wā luahine, he mea i ʻāpono ʻia kēlā. ʻO ka palena kēia o ka moʻolelo.

Moʻolelo 9. Moʻolelo O Pele A Me Ka ʻŌhelo

ʻO kaʻu moʻolelo e haʻi aku ana au iā ʻoukou, ʻo ia hoʻi e pili ana iā Pele a e pili ana i ka hua ʻōhelo. Lohe au i ka ʻōlelo ʻia i kekahi manawa ke ōlaʻi, “ʻĀ, e hoʻi mai ana ka wahine i ka lua,” a ʻo ka wahine hoʻi, ʻo ia nō ʻo Pele, a ʻo ka lua, ʻo ia nō ʻo Halemaʻumaʻu. Ua ʻōlelo ʻia mai iaʻu, he ʻelua ʻano pele, ʻo ia hoʻi ka pele kamaʻāina a me ka pele malihini. ʻO ka pele kamaʻāina, ʻo ia ka pele e ʻā ana i Halemaʻumaʻu, a ʻo ka pele malihini, ʻo ia ka pele ʻauana, hū ma ʻō ma ʻaneʻi, kahe ma ʻō ma ʻaneʻi. ʻO ia nō paha kēia pele a kākou e ʻike nei i kēia lā.
I koʻu wā ʻōpiopio, ua lohe au e pili ana i ka hua ʻōhelo. ʻŌlelo ʻia maila e nā mākua iā mākou, “Mai ʻai i ka hua ʻōhelo, na Pele wale nō kēlā!” A hoʻokahi manawa i ʻā ai ka pele i Halemaʻumaʻu, a ua hele mākou e ʻike. ʻO ka ʻōhelo hoʻi, ulu ma ka lua pele ma kaʻe o ke alanui. Nui ʻino. A hele aku nei mākou a kokoke i ka lua. Kū ke kaʻa. A hele mākou e ʻohi lālā me ka hua ʻōhelo. ʻŌlelo maila ʻo ʻAnakē Luika, “E hāʻawi ana kākou i kēia ʻōhelo he makana na Pele. ʻO kāna mea makemake kēia, ʻo ka hua ʻōhelo.” No laila ua hele mākou a Halemaʻumaʻu a ua kiloi mākou i nā ʻōhelo i loko o ka lua ahi.
A i kekahi wā i ʻā hou ai ka pele, ua ʻōlelo mai koʻu makuahine iaʻu, “I ka lā ʻapōpō, e hele kākou i ka lua pele, e holoholo.” A i ke ala ʻana aʻe i ke kakahiaka, ʻōlelo aku nei au i kuʻu makuahine, “Ua loaʻa iaʻu ka maʻi wahine.” Aʻōlelo mai koʻu makuahine iaʻu, “ʻĀ, ʻaʻole hiki iā kākou ke hele i ka lua pele. Aia a pau kou maʻi wahine.” Nīnau aku nei au, “No ke aha hoʻi?” A ʻōlelo mai nei koʻu makuahine iaʻu, “Haumia ʻoe! No laila ʻaʻole kēia ʻo ka manawa e hele ai a kokoke i ka lua pele.” No laila ua hoʻopaneʻe ʻia ko mākou alahele. A pau koʻu maʻi wahine ʻā, hele ana mākou i ka holoholo i ka lua pele. ʻO wau, ʻo kaʻu poʻe keiki ʻehā, me koʻu makuahine, me koʻu kaikunāne. Hele aku nei mākou a hiki i ʻŌlaʻa. I kēia manawa hoʻi ke kapa ʻia nei kēlā ʻo Keaʻau. A ʻōlelo mai nei ʻo Māmā, “E kū aku ke kaʻa ma ka hale kūʻai.” A hele aku mākou a ka hale kūʻai, kū ke kaʻa, a komo aku nei ʻo Māmā i loko o ka hale kūʻai. Uhai aku nei au iā ia a ʻike aku nei au iā ia. E kūʻai ana ʻo ia i ʻōmole kini — he ʻōmole nui a he ʻano kini maikaʻi. ʻŌlelo aku ʻo Māmā i ka mea o kēlā hale kūʻai, “E ʻōwili mai i kēlā ʻōmole i makana.” A ʻōwili ʻia maila me ka pepa makana. A ua lawe mai ʻo Māmā i mau lau lāʻī; i loko o ke kaʻa nō, kahi i waiho ʻia ai. A kau aku nei māua i luna o ke kaʻa. ʻŌwili mai nei ʻo Māmā i kēlā mau lāʻī ma waho o kēlā pūʻolo i loaʻa maila iā ia mai loko mai o ka hale kūʻai. A hele aku nei mākou i ka lua pele. A hōʻea mākou i Halemaʻumaʻu, a hele akula ʻo Māmā a i ke kaʻe o ka lua. A kūlou kona poʻo no ka wā pōkole. A pau, ʻā, kiloi ʻo ia i ka pūʻolo makana, ʻo ia hoʻi kēlā ʻōmole kini, i loko o ka lua. He mau minuke ma hope mai, puhi ʻia maila e ka makani he mau ʻāpana pepa mai loko mai o ka lua. A ua like kēlā pepa me ka pepa i ʻōwili ʻia ai ka makana, ka ʻōmole kini. A ua ʻike au. A ʻōlelo aʻela ʻo Māmā, “ʻĀ, ua ʻapo maila ʻo ia i ka makana.” ʻAe, ua ʻikemaka au i kēia.
A e pili ana hoʻi i ka ʻōhelo, ʻaʻole nō au i ʻai i ka ʻōhelo a hiki i ka piha ʻana iaʻu he kanaono makahiki a ʻoi. Ua hāʻule koʻu makuahine a ua hoʻomaha loa au a e noho ana au ma Kapaʻahu. Hoʻokahi lā, komo mai nei i kuʻu home he mau hoaaloha haole, a ʻōlelo mai iaʻu, “E lawe mai i pola i hāʻawi aku māua iā ʻoe i hua ʻōhelo. I ka lua pele aku nei māua, i ka ʻohi ʻōhelo. Nui ʻino ka ʻōhelo a e hana pai ana māua, hana kele. No laila, e hāʻawi aku ana māua iā ʻoe i kekahi ʻōhelo nāu.” A i kēlā manawa, ua hāʻupu au i ka mea i ʻōlelo ʻia mai iaʻu i koʻu wā ʻōpio, ʻo ia hoʻi, ʻaʻole e ʻai i ka hua ʻōhelo. No laila ua hōʻole aku wau i kuʻu mau hoaaloha. ʻAʻole naʻe au i haʻi i koʻu manaʻo. Ma hope mai, ua noʻonoʻo nui au. Inā hiki i koʻu mau hoaaloha ke ʻai i ka ʻōhelo, ʻaʻohe he pilikia. No laila, pehea hoʻi e hiki ʻole ai iaʻu ke ʻai, ʻoiai ua hala koʻu makuahine ka mea i ʻōlelo mai iaʻu he kapu ka ʻōhelo? No laila, ua kaukau wau i koʻu makuahine, ua hala ʻo ia, ua hala nā kapu. A ma hope mai ua hele au e ʻohi ʻōhelo. Hoʻi mai ana au a ka hale. Kupa au, hana au i kele. A ua ʻai au me ke ʻano kānalua nō i loko o koʻu noʻonoʻo. A ua pule au i ka Makualani a ua hoʻomau koʻu ʻai ʻana i ka ʻōhelo. A i kēia manawa hoʻi ua pau kēlā ʻano noʻonoʻo, kānalua, ʻoiai i kēia manawa, ke hana ʻia nei ka ʻōhelo i pai, i kele. I loko o nā hōkele, ke kūʻai ʻia nei. ʻAe, he au hou kēia. Ua hala nā mea kahiko. ʻO ka palena kēia o kēia moʻolelo.

Moʻolelo 10. Hoʻomanaʻo ʻAna Iā Wahaʻula

Ua hānau ʻia au a ua noho paʻa au ma lalo o ke aka o Wahaʻula, no ka mea ua kokoke ka home o koʻu ʻohana i kēlā heiau kahiko. Aia kēlā heiau i kēlā wahi i kapa ʻia ʻo Kaʻuka. Ua kūʻai koʻu makuakāne i kēlā ʻāina a ua mālama mākou i kēlā wahi. No laila, he kamaʻāina au a he kupa no kēlā wahi. ʻO ia nā lā aʻu i mahalo nui ai.
ʻO kēlā mau wahi aʻu i haʻi ai ma kaʻu mau moʻolelo, ʻaʻohe i kēia wā, koe nō ʻo Wahaʻula Heiau. ʻO Kapaʻahu a me nā wahi ʻē aʻe, ua uhi ʻia e Pele i kēlā hū ʻana mai, mai Puʻuʻōʻō mai. ʻO ia ka wā i uhi ʻia ai koʻu hale, i loko o Nowemapa, makahiki ʻumikūmāiwa kanawalukūmāono, ka lā ma mua o ka Lā Hoʻomaikaʻi. Hoʻomanaʻo aʻela au i nā mea a kuʻu makuahine i ʻōlelo mai ai iaʻu, “Inā e hele mai ʻo Pele a uhi i ka ʻāina, hāʻawi iā ia i ka ʻāina, no ka mea nāna nō i hana i kēia ʻāina. E mau loa ana ʻo ia ma ʻaneʻi nei. ʻO ʻoe a me aʻu, noho manawa wale nō kāua ma ʻaneʻi nei.” A laila, nīnau aku au iā ia, “Pehea ka hale?” Pane mai ʻo ia, “Hāʻawi iā ia.”
No laila, ua hiki mai ka manawa, ua hū ka pele, a ua lawe ʻo Pele i nā mea a pau. Akā, pehea ka luku, ka lauahi o Pele, ua ʻike au i kekahi manawa i kona nani, ke kupaianaha a me ka ʻeʻehia, i kona mana. Mai Puʻuʻōʻō mai kēia kahe ʻana o ka pele a ʻau i ke kai. Ua manaʻo mākou e uhi ʻia ana ʻo Wahaʻula keiau, no ka mea uhi ʻia nā mea a pau. Mau ke kahe ʻana o ka pele a pili, a kaʻapuni ʻia ka pā pōhaku o ka heiau. Aia naʻe ʻo loko o ka pā heiau, ʻaʻole i hoʻopā ʻia. Mau ke kahe ʻana o ka pele a hōʻea i ke kai. I koʻu lohe ʻana, ʻaʻole i uhi ʻia ʻo Wahaʻula Heiau, kohu mea ua kāpae mai ʻo ia i koʻu ʻiʻini. Ua nīnau au i loko oʻu, “Pehea lā kēia, no ke aha lā? ʻAno kupaianaha.”

Ma muli o koʻu ʻimi ʻana i ke kumu manaʻo e pili ana i kēia heiau, ua heluhelu au. Mai kinohi mai, ua hele mai ke aliʻi nui Pili a me ke kahuna nui Paʻao i Hawaiʻi nei, mai ka Pākīpika Hema mai, i loko o ka makahiki ʻumikūmāhā kanahākūmākahi A.D. A ua lawe lāua i nā hana o kēia aupuni. Ua ʻike lāua e pono e kūkulu ʻia ʻekolu heiau no ko lākou akua mana, ʻo ia hoʻi ʻo Kū, i hoʻopae ʻia mai e lāua. ʻO ke ʻano mōhai a ko lāua akua, ʻo ia hoʻi ka mōhai kanaka. Kūkulu ʻia ʻekolu heiau luakini, ʻoia nō ʻo Wahaʻula, aia i Puna, ʻo Moʻokini, aia i Kōhala, a me Hikiau, aia i Kealakekua, Kona. Ua haʻi ʻia ma ka moʻolelo, ma kahi o ka ʻelima haneli ka nui o ka mōhai kanaka i mōhai ʻia i Wahaʻula Heiau. ʻO ka mōhai hope loa, ma kahi ia o ka makahiki ʻumikūmāwalu ʻumikūmāiwa.
E hoʻomanaʻo mau ʻia ana au e kuʻu makuahine a me nā kūpuna i ka mana o kēlā wahi, aia nō a hiki i kēia wā. Ua maopopo ʻia e lākou. Hoʻokahi lā ua hele au ma laila, a ua lohe au i ka ʻō mai nā kūpuna mai. ʻO koʻu makuahine, ua hānau ʻia ʻo ia a ua noho paʻa ʻo ia i Kapaʻahu. Haʻi mai ʻo ia iaʻu ʻo Wahaʻula, he puʻuhonua nō. Inā ua hana hewa ke kanaka a e alualu ʻia ana ʻo ia no ka hoʻopaʻi, inā ʻo ia e holo a hoʻopā i ka pā pōhaku e kaʻapuni ana i ka heiau, ma ka ʻaoʻao ma Kaʻū, ua pākele ʻo ia mai ka hoʻopaʻi ʻia.
Ma hope o ka pau ʻana o ke kahe o ka pele ma Kapaʻahu, ua ʻae mai ka ʻOihana Pāka Pekelala i ka poʻe e hele e mākaʻikaʻi iā Wahaʻula. Ua nui koʻu ʻiʻini e ʻike hou iā Wahaʻula no hoʻokahi manawa i koe. I loko o ʻAukake, lā iwakāluakūmālima, makahiki ʻumikūmāiwa kanaiwakūmākahi, ua hele au me ka hana nui, ma luna o ke ʻaʻā me ka pāhoehoe, a hiki i kuʻu ʻike ʻana iā Wahaʻula. Hauʻoli au i kuʻu ʻike hou ʻana, me ka kaumaha pū a me ka ʻāpono. No laila, ua kau koʻu manaʻo e kākau i ka moʻolelo a me ka hoʻomanaʻo ʻana iā Wahaʻula.


Kiʻi 13. ʻO Wahaʻula, he heiau luakini, ma mua o ka uhi ʻia ʻana e ka pele.


Aloha Wahaʻula

Mai ka wā kahiko mai
Ua lawe ʻia mai ʻoe
Me kou mana
I Kaʻuka nei
Mai ka mokuʻāina Pākīpika
Ua pau kāu hana.
Ua hoʻopuni ihola ʻo Pele iā ʻoe
Me kona kapa ʻula, me ke ʻaʻā.
Ke hoʻohiamoe nei ʻo ia iā ʻoe
Me kou mana

Aloha Wahaʻula.

 He mea ʻai nui ka iʻa i ka poʻe Hawaiʻi a hiki i kēia lā i mea e momona ala ke kino.  Nui nā ʻano iʻa like ʻole, a ʻai ʻia ka nui e kākou.  Hana maka ʻia kekahi ma ka poke paha, ma ka lomilomi paha, ma ka palu paha.  A ʻānoni ʻia me ka iʻa maka, ka limu, ka nīoi, ke ake iʻa, ke kai hāʻukeʻuke, ke kai wana me ka paʻakai.  ʻOno loa ka ʻōpelu, ka ʻōʻio, ke kole, ka uhu, ke kole nuku heu, ka ʻōhua, a me ka ʻupāpalu paha.  Hana maloʻo ʻia kekahi mau iʻa.  Kaha ʻia ka ʻōpū, wehe i ka naʻau, kōpī, kaka a kaulaʻi.  Maikaʻi ka ʻōpelu, ke akule, ka ʻōhua, ke aku me ka ʻūʻū no ke kaulaʻi ʻana.  Pūlehu ʻia kekahi iʻa.  ʻO ke kala, ka manini, ka palani, ka māʻiʻi, me ka pākuʻikuʻi. Pūlehu ʻia ka iʻa me ke kau ʻia ʻana o ka iʻa holoʻokoʻa me ka naʻau a me^^ ka unahi nō ma luna o ka nānahu.  Lāwalu ʻia ke kūmū, ka uouoa, ka ʻanae, me ka moano.  ʻO ka lāwalu, he wahī ʻia ka iʻa i loko o ka lāʻī a pūlehu ʻia ma luna o ka nānahu.  ʻO ia ke ʻano o nā iʻa ʻono i hoʻomākaukau ʻia no ka ʻai ʻana i ka^^ puʻu ke momoni iho.

58:21 LK: ʻAe.  ʻO ia wale ihola ka manawa o kēia ahiahi.  Ua pau ko mākou hola no kēia manawa.  Ma mua nō naʻe o ka hoʻopau ʻana, makemake nui koʻu e mahalo aku i ka poʻe i hana, kōkua mai no kēia papahana.  ʻO Pat, a, Unabia, ka mea e haʻi ana ma ka ʻōlelo Hawa^^ a, haole.  A, nā mea hoʻokani pila, ʻo Lorna and Mikala McClellen, Kuʻuleimomo Bernardino, Momilani Kalāʻaukahi, Eldon Akamine, Kaniela Akaka.  A ʻo nā mea e kamaʻilio ana no ka mokupuni o Maui, ʻo Mikahala Achan, me Kaniela Akaka.  A ʻo ka mea e haʻiʻōlelo ana, i haʻiʻōlelo no ka, no nā iʻa ʻono o ka ʻāina, ʻo Ed Lampsly.  A me nā ʻōlelo aloha, ʻo Kalena Silva.  A me nā mea ʻelua i hoʻoholo mai i kēia poʻe mīkini o kēia ahiahi, ʻo Eldon Akamine, me Harold, ke keiki hoʻolele leo o KCCN.  No laila, aloha a nui loa iā ʻoukou a pau loa, a hui hou aku kākou.
59:36 HB  #Those interested in pursuing Hawaiian language and culture, can write the Hawaiian language for Department at University of Hawaiʻi.  Hawaiʻi is yours and mine, our only home.  Let's live our Hawaiian culture.
59:49  Hawaiʻi Aloha 
59:56 KS ## ʻAnoʻai ke aloha e nā pua o ka ʻāina.  Ua pā iho nei ko ʻoukou mau pepeiao i Ka Leo Hawaiʻi o ke ahiahi a me nā mele aloha o ka ʻāina, me he kahawai lā, e ʻōlino mau, e nanahe mau, a e nani mau.  Aloha a nui loa iā ʻoukou a pau, a hui hou aku kākou.

 Mai nā aheahe makani e pā mai nei, pā mai nei

00:48 KS ## ʻAuhea ʻoukou e nā makamaka.  E hoʻolohe mai iā mākou, nā ʻōpio o ke Kulanui o Hawaiʻi.  E lohe ana ʻoukou i nā mea e pili ana i nā hana, a me nā ʻike o nā kūpuna i aloha nui ʻia.  E hoʻolele ana Ka Leo Hawaiʻi i nā Poʻalua o kēlā me kēia pule ʻelua.  E hoʻomaka ana kēia hoʻolele leo i
01:23 kēia manawa, ka hola ʻewalu o ke ahiahi.
01:24 h:HB @ Welcome to Ka Leo Hawaiʻi.  In this evening's presentation of Ka Leo Hawaiʻi, students will participate in two dialogues.  The first involves a young lady just back from the island of Kauaʻi and a friend of hers.  Their discussion centers on her trip and the various attractions of Kauaʻi.  The second dialogue was especially written for a song entered by the Hui Aloha ʻĀina Tuahine in the Department of Parks and Recreation Hawaiian Song Contest.  The story involves a girl and a boy and an experience of theirs with the thorny kolū bush.  The first dialogue will be accompanied by songs about the island of Kauaʻi, and the second by the student's composition, Ka Pua Kolū Nani Loa.  The guest for tonight's live section is Reverend Louis Grace, a native of Nāpoʻopoʻo, South Kona.

04:52 h:PN  Ka Mokupuni ʻO Kauaʻi:
 E Kaipo, ʻaʻala kou lei mokihana me ka maile lau liʻi.  Ma hea mai kēnā lei uʻi?
05:03 h:h1 ʻAkahi nō wau a hoʻi mai mai Kauaʻi mai.  Naʻu i kiʻi i kēia lei mai Kōkeʻe mai.
05:10 h:PN Pehea?  Ua mālie ʻo Kōkeʻe?
05:13 h:h1 ʻAʻole.  ʻAno uhiwai nō.  Akā, ua ʻike lihi au iā Kalalau me ke awāwa nani o Waimea.
05:23 h:PN Ua lohe aku nei ʻoe i ke kani walu honehone a ka moa?
05:27 h: h1 ʻAe.  I kuʻu iho ʻana i kai, ʻike wau i nā moa e ʻai ana i ka palama ma ka ʻaoʻao o ke alanui.  A hālō aʻe wau iā Niʻihau i ka ʻehu kai.
05:39 h:PN Ua iho ʻoe i kai o hea?
05:42 h:h1 U^^, ua hōʻea wau i ke one kani o Nohili me Polihale i ka pahapaha lei.  Ma laila aku, hele aku wau i Waimea.
05:52 h:PN A, ma Waimea i kū mua ai ʻo Kāpena Kuke.  Ua ʻike aku ʻoe i ka ʻāina hānau o Kūhiō Kalanianaʻole?
06:01 h:h1 ʻAe.  Mahalo au i ka nani o Poʻipū me Kukuiʻula, kahi hānau o Kūhiō.  Nanea wau i ke kaha nalu o ia kaha.
06:11 h:PN Nani mai hoʻi kau ʻo Hāʻena me nā pali.
06:14 h:h1 Pololei.  I koʻu hele ʻana i kēlā ʻaoʻao, hele wāwae au i Hanakāpīʻai.  Nui ka ʻōpae, ka ʻoʻopu, ka wī me ka ʻōhiʻa ʻai.
06:26 h:PN He mau ana nui ko Hāʻena.  He ana wai kekahi, a he ana maloʻo kekahi.  Auē hoʻi ka nani o Hanalei.  A pehea ka nani o Hanalei iā ʻoe?
06:38 h:h1 Aloha wau i ke kūʻono laulā.  He ʻāina ulu kalo ʻo Hanalei no ka lawa pono o ka ua.  Kaulana ʻo Hanalei i ka ua loku.
06:49 h:PN Kūkilakila ka hale ipu kukui i ka lae ʻo Kīlauea me ke kai hānupanupa a me nā manu ʻā e pōʻai ana.  Aia hoʻi ma Kīlauea kekahi paheʻe wai i hana ʻia no ke kiʻiʻoniʻoni ʻo South Pacific. Aia i uka i ke kuahiwi.  He wahi i kapa ʻia ʻo Waipaheʻe.  Na ka wai i hana kēia paheʻe wai.  A na ke kanaka i hana ka pahe^^ (paheʻe) wai ʻo Kīlauea.
07:15 h:h1 ʻOluʻolu nō koʻu holo wai ʻana ma ka muliwai ʻo Wailua a hiki i ka pae ʻana i ke ana kupukupu.
07:23 h:PN ʻO Wailua kahi i hānai ʻia ai ʻo Kawelo, ʻeā?
07:27 h:h1 ʻAe, ʻoiaʻiʻo nō.  A aia ma uka o ka heiau ʻo Holoholokū, nā pōhaku kāni^^ (kani).  ʻŌlelo ʻia i ka wā kahiko, hoʻokani ʻia nā pōhaku i mea hoʻolono no ka poʻe o Wailua.  Eia he wahi mea ʻono kuki macadamia nāu mai Līhuʻe mai.
07:49 h:PN Mahalo no ka mea ʻono kuki o Kauaʻi.  Aloha.  A hui hou.
07:54 h:h1 A hui hou nō.

10:27 h:HB A girlʻs mokihana lei initiated the previous discussion on the island of Kauaʻi.  She and her friend talked about areas she had visited such as Kōkeʻe, Waimea, Hāʻena, Poʻipū, Hanalei, and Wailua.  Her friend had also been to Kauaʻi and seemed to find Kīlauea especially interesting.  The accompanying songs both dealt with the island.

14:43 h:HB The short dialogue you just heard was about the kolū flower and its thorns which pricked the feet of a girl.  At first, she isn't impressed by the kolū bush because it isn't pretty.  But after her friend shows her the flower which is indeed pretty and very fragrant, she changes her mind.  The music and words of the accompanying song, Ka Pua Kolū Nani Loa were written by members of the Hui Aloha ʻĀina Tuahine.  It took third prize in the Parks and Recreation Song Contest._

Papa Kuhikuhi Kikoʻī .....................24

He Ala i Maʻa i ka Hele ʻIa

“Na wai hoʻi ka ʻole o ke akamai, he alanui i maʻa i ka hele ʻia e oʻu mau mākua?”

He ʻōlelo puanaʻī kēia na Liholiho, na Kamehameha II hoʻi, e hōʻoia ana i ka mea nui o ka ʻike Hawaiʻi, he ʻike a he hana waiwai i paʻa iā ia a i nā hanauna Hawaiʻi ma mua ona.

He like nō kēia ʻike Hawaiʻi me ka meheu. ʻO ka meheu, ʻo ia nā kapuaʻi wāwae ma ke ala nui o kona hele ʻia. No ka nui o nā meheu wāwae, ua akāka ke ala e hele ai.

Kapa ʻia ke ala o nā ʻike Hawaiʻi like ʻole, he moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi. Aia i ka moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi, nā “kapuaʻi” ʻōlelo, ʻike, a me nā hana e Hawaiʻi ai ke kanaka a me ka lāhui Hawaiʻi.

ʻO kā Liholiho, he naʻauao ke kanaka e kau kona mau kapuaʻi wāwae i ke ala o ka ʻike moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi mai nā kūpuna mai, i ola ia moʻomeheu i kēia hanauna a ia hanauna aku. Na wai nō hoʻi e ʻole ka pūlama i ia ʻike kupuna makamae?

Pehea, e ka mea heluhelu, ua hele wāwae paha ʻoe i kekahi alahele o uka, o kai paha? Ua noʻonoʻo paha ʻoe i ke kumu i hāmama ai ke ala? Na kekahi ia ala i waele, a ua hāmama hoʻi iā ʻoe i ka nui o nā wāwae i hele mua ma ia ala.

Nā Kumuwaiwai ʻIke Hawaiʻi

I loko nō o nā loli o ke au, ua hoʻopaʻa nā kūpuna i nā ʻike moʻomeheu like ʻole – he ʻano alahele i ka naʻauao e hahai aku ai kākou.

Ua hoʻopaʻa kekahi poʻe i ka ʻike moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi ma nā kumuwaiwai he nui. Ua wānana kūpono ia poʻe naʻauao i ke koʻikoʻi o ka hoʻopaʻa ʻana iho i ia ʻike. Pēlā nō i mālama ʻia ai a hiki i kēia lā.

ʻO ka ʻimi ʻana aku i ia ʻike kupuna ka hana i koe. Ma hea hoʻi e ʻimi ai i ia mau ʻike?

Nā Nūpepa ʻŌlelo Hawaiʻi Kahiko

Ua nui wale nā ʻike a me nā kumuhana Hawaiʻi like ʻole ma loko o nā nūpepa i hoʻomaka i ka makahiki 1834 ma hope iho o ka hiki ʻana mai o nā mikionele i Hawaiʻi nei i ka makahiki 1820. Ma ia wā, he mea hou loa ka palapala ʻana i ka ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi, ʻoiai he ʻōlelo haʻi waha ia ma mua. Ua ʻapo koke nō naʻe nā Hawaiʻi i ka palapala, a kākau ihola i nā moʻolelo like ʻole ma ka ʻōlelo makamae o ka ʻāina.

He nui wale nā lima i komo i ke kākau ʻana i ia mau moʻolelo nūpepa. Ma laila i palapala ʻia ai nā kaʻao, ka mōʻaukala kahiko, nā mele, ka haʻilono o ia wā, a me nā mea hoihoi a kamahaʻo paha o ke ao.

Ma ka ʻapo ʻana i ka palapala ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi i paʻa ai nā nūpepa a me nā kumuwaiwai ʻē aʻe o ka ʻōlelo i kākau a paʻi ʻia e like me nā palapala aupuni, nā puke moʻomanaʻo, nā puke mele, a me nā leka. He mea nō hoʻi ka palapala ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi e hiki ai i ke kanaka ke ʻapo, hahai, a mālama kūpono i nā meheu ʻike o nā kūpuna.

Nā Puke Wehewehe ʻŌlelo

ʻO kekahi mau ʻōlelo o ka honua nei, ke maopopo ʻole ka manaʻo o kekahi huaʻōlelo, e hiki i ke kanaka ke huli i loko o ka puke wehewehe o ia ʻōlelo a loaʻa mai ka manaʻo. Pēlā nō ka ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi. ʻO kekahi mea nui loa o kona mahalo ʻia, ʻo ia nō ka puke wehewehe ʻōlelo ʻo Hawaiian Dictionary na Mary Kawena Pukui lāua ʻo Samuel H. Elbert. He puke koʻikoʻi maoli nō i ili mai ai nā manaʻo o ka hapa nui o nā huaʻōlelo Hawaiʻi i paʻa iā kākou nei.

He mau makahiki lōʻihi nō ka hoʻopaʻa huaʻōlelo ʻana. Ma ka nui, na Pukui ka hōʻoia ʻana i ka pololei o nā manaʻo huaʻōlelo, a na Elbert ka hoʻonohonoho ʻana i kū i nā puke wehewehe ʻōlelo o ko lāua manawa. I loko o ka nui launa ʻole o ia hana, ua paʻu aku lāua a ʻonipaʻa. I loa nō a ʻike a lohe paha ʻo Pukui i huaʻōlelo i komo ʻole i ka puke wehewehe ʻōlelo, ʻo kona hoʻopaʻa ihola nō ia i luna o ka pepa (he ʻāpana wahī leka weluwelu i kekahi manawa), a hoʻokomo ihola i ka pahu i piha i nā huaʻōlelo āna i hōʻiliʻili ai.

ʻO ia noke akula ʻo Pukui lāua ʻo Elbert i ka noiʻi noelo ʻana a paʻa pono ʻeono paʻi ʻana o kā lāua puke kaulana. Pēlā nō i waele ai i ia ala moʻomeheu e naʻauao ai ka poʻe ma hope o lāua.

Nā Nīnauele Mānaleo

ʻO kekahi kumuwaiwai nui loa e ola ai ka ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi,ʻo ia nā waihona leo nīnauele o nā kūpuna mānaleo. ʻO Pukui kekahi o nā kānaka mua loa i ʻokileo i ia ʻano nīnauele makamae. ʻAʻole i laha loa ka ʻenehana mīkini ʻokileo i ia wā, ua ʻike nō naʻe ʻo Pukui i ka waiwai, a paʻa ihola iā ia he mau waihona leo o nā kūpuna mānaleo.

ʻO ka nui o ia ʻano waihona leo kupuna i koe mai, na Larry Kimura ia no kona wā i hoʻokele ai i ka polokalamu lēkiō ʻo Ka Leo Hawaiʻi. He ʻumikūmāono makahiki o kona ʻokileo ʻana i ke kūkā kamaʻilio ʻana me nā mānaleo mai Hawaiʻi a Niʻihau.

Ua kamaʻilio ʻia nā hana kuʻuna like ʻole o ka nohona Hawaiʻi: ʻo ka lawaiʻa, ka haku lei, ka mahi ʻai, nā moʻolelo a nā kupa no ʻō a ʻō o ka pae ʻāina nei, a nui hou aku. ʻO kekahi o nā mēheuheu nani lua ʻole, ʻo ia ka leo hone o ia mau kūpuna e lohe ʻia ma ia mau waihona leo i paʻa ma mua o ko lākou haʻalele ʻana aku i ke ala hoʻi ʻole mai.

No ua mau kumu nei i lilo ai kēia mau nīnauele he kumuwaiwai nui koʻikoʻi e hoʻomaopopo a hoʻomau aku ai kākou i nā ʻike Hawaiʻi.

Nā Loli o ke Au

He Honua Ola

ʻO ka ʻonipaʻa o nā kūpuna i kūkulu i nā kumuwaiwai ʻike Hawaiʻi kahiko, he mea kū maoli ia i ko kākou mahalo a me ka hoʻomaikaʻi. He honua ola nō naʻe hoʻi kēia e loli ai ka nohona kanaka a e kū mai ai nā mea hou i ke au o ka manawa.

Aia i kēlā me kēia ke koho ʻana pehea e komo ai ka mea hou i ka noho ʻana. Pēlā i ʻapo a hoʻohana ai nā kūpuna i nā mea hou e like me ka palapala a me ka mīkini ʻokileo e paʻa ai ka moʻomeheu no nā hanauna hou. He aha kā kākou mau mea e ʻapo a hoʻohana ai?

Ke Kōmike Lekikona

I ka loli ʻana o ke au, he kū mai nō nā mea hou, a pono ka huaʻōlelo e maopopo mai ai ka manaʻo o ia mea hou. ʻO ka haku ʻana i ia ʻano huaʻōlelo, ʻo ia ka hana a ke Kōmike Lekikona.

Aia ma ke Kōmike Lekikona nā kānaka mākaukau loa ma ka ʻōlelo makuahine mai nā mokupuni like ʻole. Ma ka hālāwai ʻana, hāpai nā hoa kōmike i nā kumuhana like ʻole e haku ʻia ai nā huaʻōlelo hou. ʻImi ʻia ke kōkua o nā kānaka i loea ma nā kumuhana kikoʻī, e laʻa me ka ʻenehana hoʻonanea, ka haʻilono, a me ka ʻike maluō.

Ka Haku Huaʻōlelo Hou

Ma hope o ke kūkākūkā ʻana o nā hoa Kōmike Lekikona no ka huaʻōlelo hou (mai ka ʻōlelo Pelekānia mai ka nui), he mau kiʻina e haku ai i ka huaʻōlelo penei: E ʻimi i ka huaʻōlelo kokoke loa o kona manaʻo i ko ka mea hou; e wehewehe i ka manaʻo; e kiʻi i huaʻōlelo ʻōiwi ʻē aʻe i like ka manaʻo; e hoʻohawaiʻi i ke kani o ka huaʻōlelo; a he mau kiʻina hou aku nō.

A paʻa maikaʻi ka huaʻōlelo hou, komo ia i ka ʻohina huaʻōlelo hou e hoʻopuka ʻia nei ma Nā Puke Wehewehe ʻŌlelo Hawaiʻi ma ke kaha pūnaewele ʻo Ulukau. ʻO Māmaka Kaiao ka inoa o ia ʻohina “i mea e māmaka ai i ka ʻōlelo a puka he kaiao hou.”

He kōkua kēia mau huaʻōlelo hou iā kākou o ke au nei, ʻoiai e komo ana ka poʻe ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi i loko o nā ʻoihana like ʻole he nui wale. He mau ʻelele nō hoʻi no ka ʻōlelo makuahine nāna e lawe ana i ka moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi i mua i loko o nā pōʻaiapili hou. E lawe ana kākou i ka ʻōlelo ʻōiwi a me kona mau huaʻōlelo hou i loko o kā kākou mau hana.

ʻO “lolouila” kekahi huaʻōlelo hou no ia mīkini he kohu lolo noʻonoʻo nō o ke kanaka i hoʻoholo ʻia e ka uila. (Hoʻohana kekahi poʻe i ka huaʻōlelo “kamepiula” no ia mīkini hoʻokahi i hoʻohawaiʻi ʻia ai ke kani o ka huaʻōlelo Pelekānia).

He huaʻōlelo waiwai ʻo lolouila, ʻoiai he ʻenehana mea nui ia o kēia wā e holomua ai nā ʻano hana like ʻole he nui wale. He mea nui nō hoʻi ia ma ka ʻoihana hoʻonanea e like me ka hoʻomohala pāʻani wikiō. Pehea lā ke kamaʻilio Hawaiʻi ʻana o kēia wā inā ua nele i ka huaʻōlelo ʻole no kēia mīkini kamahaʻo?

I ke au kahiko, ma ka leo o ka waha i kaʻa ai ka ʻike a me ka manaʻo o kānaka, kekahi i kekahi. A hiki mai ka palapala, ʻo ke kākau a me ka heluhelu kekahi mau ʻano hou o ka hoʻokaʻaʻike ʻana. A hiki mai hoʻi i kēia wā nei o ka lēkiō, ke kīwī, a me ka pūnaewele, ua pono he huaʻōlelo no ia mau ʻano hou o ka hoʻokaʻaʻike ʻana.

Pēlā i kupu mai ai ʻo “pāpaho,” he huaʻōlelo i lawe ʻia mai ka ʻōlelo Māori mai. ʻO ka lawe ʻana i ka huaʻōlelo mai kekahi ʻōlelo ʻōiwi mai, ʻoi loa nā hoa ʻōlelo Polenekia e like me ka Māori, he kiʻina hana ia e lako ai ka ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi i nā huaʻōlelo hou.

He mea nui ka pāpaho i ka ʻoihana haʻilono o kēia wā. Ua nui nā ʻano pāpaho like ʻole a ke kanaka haʻilono e hoʻohana ai i ka hoʻolaha nūhou o ke ao.

Ua maʻa ka poʻe o ka wā kahiko i ka mālama a hoʻomalu ʻana i ka ʻāina i ō mau, i ola ikaika nō hoʻi kānaka. I kēia wā, no ka ʻokoʻa o ka nohona a me ka pilina me ka ʻāina, ʻaʻole i like ka mālama a hoʻomalu ʻana o ka poʻe.

No laila i haku ai ke Kōmike Lekikona i ka huaʻōlelo ʻo “maluō” i mea hoʻomanaʻo i ke koʻikoʻi o ka nohona hoʻomalu o ke kanaka ma ka ʻāina. Mālama a kiaʻi ka poʻe ʻoihana hoʻomaluō i ke ola o ka lani, ka ʻāina, a me ke kai, i ola pū kākou kānaka.

Panina: E ʻOnipaʻa Mau i ka Meheu

ʻO nā kumuwaiwai kahiko a hou i hōʻike ʻia aʻela, ke kū maila nō ma luna o ka hoʻoilina Hawaiʻi, he ala ʻike mēheuheu i waele mua ʻia e nā kūpuna. ʻAʻole naʻe na nā kūpuna wale nō ka waele ʻana i ia ala ʻike. Na kēlā me kēia hanauna pū aku hoʻi ka waele ʻana ma ka ʻimi noelo, ka mālama, a me ka hoʻomau ʻana a ola a māhuahua hou aʻe ma nā pōʻaipili hou o ke ao.

Pēlā e alahula ai ia ala ʻike mēheuheu i ka hele like ʻia e nā hanauna hou e hiki mai ana! Na ia mau hanauna e hoʻomau a hoʻolaupaʻi aku nō i ka ʻonipaʻa i ka meheu.

Nā Hua‘ōlelo Ko‘iko‘i

moʻomeheu: He mau ʻike kuʻuna, kuanaʻike, a hana noʻeau a kekahi lāhui kanaka. ʻO ka hula, ke oli, ka hīmeni, a me ka haʻiʻōlelo kekahi mau ʻike a hana moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi i hoʻokumu ʻia ma luna o kekahi ʻike kuʻuna, ʻo ka ʻōlelo.

"Ke aʻo ke keiki i kāna ʻōlelo makua, pēlā ō ai ka moʻomeheu."

kumuwaiwai: He kumu o nā mea waiwai like ʻole. He kumuwaiwai ka waihona ʻike i nui kona mau ʻano, e laʻa me ka nūpepa, ka puke wehewehe ʻōlelo, a me ka nīnauele mānaleo. ʻO ka lepo kekahi ʻano kumuwaiwai o ke ao kūlohelohe.

"He kumuwaiwai makamae loa ka nūpepa Hawaiʻi kahiko."

mānaleo: He kanaka i wali iā ia kāna ʻōlelo mua i aʻo ai.

"Ke aʻo nei ka mānaleo ʻo Isaia Kealoha i nā haumāna kulanui i ka ihi ʻana i ke kalo a me nā huaʻōlelo i pili."

ʻonipaʻa: ʻO ka ʻonipaʻa ka paʻa pono mau o ka manaʻo a me ka hana me ka lolelua ʻole a me ka hāʻawipio ʻole.

"Kaulana ke aliʻi Luka Keʻelikōlani i kona ʻonipaʻa i ka ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi i ka wā i haʻalele ai kekahi poʻe i ka ʻōlelo kupa o ka ʻāina."

Papa Wehewehe Hua‘ōlelo

alahula (kikino, hehele) - He ala i hele nui ʻia e ka poʻe; ʻo ka hele pinepine ʻana ma ia ʻano ala.

ō (hehele) - ʻO ka hoʻomau ʻana a mau.

haʻilono (kikino, hamani) - ʻO ka hoʻolaha nūhou.

hone (hehele) - He kani nahenahe i ka pepeiao a ʻala onaona paha i ka ihu.

hōʻiliʻili (hamani) - ʻO ka ʻohiʻohi ʻana i kekahi mau mea ma hoʻokahi wahi.

hoʻoilina (kikino) - He mea i ili mai kekahi kanaka i kekahi kanaka.

kumuwaiwai (kikino) - He kumu o nā mea waiwai like ʻole. He kumuwaiwai ka waihona ʻike i nui kona mau ʻano, e laʻa me ka nūpepa, ka puke wehewehe ʻōlelo, a me ka nīnauele mānaleo. ʻO ka lepo momona kekahi ʻano kumuwaiwai o ke ao kūlohelohe.

lolouila (kikino) - He mīkini ʻenehana o ke ao nei. ʻO “kamepiula” kekahi ʻōlelo ʻana.

maluō (kikino) - ʻO ka malu mau o kekahi mea a ō loa.

mānaleo (kikino) - He kanaka i wali iā ia kāna ʻōlelo mua i aʻo ai.

meheu (kikino) - He kapuaʻi wāwae o ka hele ʻana, he hōʻailona o ke ala i hele mua ʻia, a he alahele nō.

mēheuheu (kikino) - He meheu i hele nui ʻia.

moʻomeheu (kikino) - He mau ʻike kuʻuna, kuanaʻike, a hana noʻeau a kekahi lāhui kanaka. ʻO ka hula, ke oli, ka hīmeni, a me ka haʻiʻōlelo kekahi mau ʻike a hana moʻomeheu Hawaiʻi i hoʻokumu ʻia ma luna o kekahi ʻike kuʻuna, ʻo ka ʻōlelo.

noiʻi noelo (hamani) - ʻO ka ʻimi ikaika a hohonu i ka ʻike a paʻa pono.

noke (hamani) - ʻO ke kāmau ikaika i ka hana me ka manaʻopaʻa, ka hāʻawipio ʻole, a me ka ʻonipaʻa.

pāpaho (kikino) - ʻO nā ʻano like ʻole e laha ai ka ʻike, e laʻa me ke kīwī, ka lēkiō, ka pūnaewele, a pēlā aku.

paʻu (hamani) - ʻO ka noke i ka hana a luhi.

waele (hamani) - ʻO ka huki ʻana i ka nāhelehele i maʻemaʻe ka ʻāina a ala paha i nui ka hele ʻia. He hana hoʻi e wehe ai i ala hou.

ʻoihana (kikino) - He hana a ke kanaka e ʻimi ai i ke ola o ka noho ʻana.

ʻoihana haʻilono (kikino) - He ʻoihana e hoʻolaha ai i ka haʻilono.

ʻoihana hoʻomaluō (kikino) - He ʻoihana e mālama ai i nā mea o ke ao kūlohelohe a maluō.

ʻoihana hoʻonanea (kikino) - He ʻoihana e hoʻomohala ai i nā ʻano hana nanea like ʻole, e laʻa me ka pāʻani wikiō.

ʻonipaʻa (ʻaʻano) - ʻO ka paʻa pono mau o ka manaʻo a me ka hana me ka lolelua ʻole a me ka hāʻawipio ʻole.

06:36  h:KK4  Ka Manu Kōlea:  
   I kēlā me kēia makahiki, hiki mai nā manu kōlea i loko o nā mahina ʻo ʻAukake a hiki i Mei.  Noho lākou i kēia pae ʻāina no ka wā hoʻoilo, a hoʻi lākou me ka hulu hinuhinu i Kahiki i ka wā kupulau.  Ke momona ke kōlea, he meaʻai ʻono kēia i ka mea kāpili manu kōlea.  ʻO ke kāpili manu kōlea, he mea ia e hopu ai i ka manu me ka maunu a me ka makau.  Hoʻopaʻa ʻia ka makau i ke aho, a ke aho hoʻi i ka pōhaku hekau.  ʻO ka ʻōpuʻupuʻu ka maunu.  I ka ʻai ʻana a ke kōlea ʻo ka ʻōpuʻupuʻu, hihia ka puʻu a paʻa ka manu.  I ka hiki ʻana mai o ka pū a ka haole, kī ʻia ka manu a i kēia lā.  A poina ʻia i ka hana kāpili, ke ʻano hana o ka wā i hala.  Hoʻopilipili ʻia ka manu kōlea i ke kanaka i kekahi manawa.  ʻO ke kanaka ia i hele mai i Hawaiʻi nei a ʻai i ka momona o ka ʻāina a waiwai.  A laila, hoʻi a haʻalele i kēia ʻāina.  Eia he wahi mele nō ia no kanaka.

Ma mua nō naʻe o ka hoʻopau ʻana o kēia papahana, makemake au e hoʻomanaʻo hou iā ʻoukou e nā mea e makemake ana e hele mai i kēia ʻaha ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi, ka mua kēia o ka ʻaha ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi e mālama ʻia nei ma ke kula, ma, ma ke Kula ʻo Kamehameha.  Inā makemake ʻoukou e hele mai i kēia ʻaha ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi, e kelepona mua iā Mrs. Bernie ma ke Kula ʻo Kamehameha.  A eia ka helu, helu ʻei^^ ʻewalu ʻehā ʻelima, ʻeono ʻeono ʻekolu ʻekahi.  A ʻo nā haumāna i kōkua lokomaikaʻi mai i kēia ahiahi ma kēia papahana, ʻo Tai Crouch ka mea i ʻōlelo ai ma ʻōlelo haole, me Pakele Freitas lāua ʻo Kiana Nāone ma ke kamaʻilio ʻana no Oʻahu, me Kuʻulei Kaikainahaole no ka haʻiʻōlelo ʻana ʻo ka manu kōlea.  A ʻo Kaniela Akaka, ʻo Pila Wilson me Eldon Akamine nā mea i, i hīmeni ai a i hoʻokani ai i ka pila.  A mahalo nui iā ʻoe, e Kahananui wahine i kou kipa ʻana mai i kēia ahiahi.  A me nā makamaka lehulehu i kōkua lokomaikaʻi mai i kēia papahana ʻo Ka Leo Hawaiʻi.  A mahalo nui iā ʻoukou e nā mea e hoʻolohe ana.  A aloha nui iā ʻoukou a pau loa.  A hui hou aku kākou.

62:47 KS ## ʻAnoʻai ke aloha e nā pua o ka ʻāina.  Ua pā iho nei ko ʻoukou mau pepeiao i Ka Leo Hawaiʻi o ke ahiahi a me nā mele aloha o ka ʻāina, me he kahawai lā, e ʻōlino mau, e nanahe mau, a e nani mau.  Aloha a nui loa iā ʻoukou a pau, a hui hou aku kākou.
